info.title: Ad Media Services
info.description: Test Macy's API using our easy to use Interactive Console! You can also view more detailed  written documentation. (Note: You must attain approval for an API key for one of the services in the drop-down menu below before being able to use the Macy's API Console.) Ad Media Services

externalDocs.description: Please contact us if you are having trouble getting access to keys: Click Here

get.summary: This service allows you to retrieve ad media speci...
get.description: This service allows you to retrieve ad media specific to a product category ID. Please click here for the static documentation.

parameters.name: accept
parameters.description: Output format as JSON or XML (Required) Ex. JSON.

parameters.name: categoryId
parameters.description: Specify one or more category Id's separated by comma. (Required) Ex. 27058

parameters.name: channel
parameters.description: Channel can be either SITE, REGISTRY (Required) Ex. SITE

parameters.name: secure
parameters.description: By default this is set to false. If set to true links in response will be https NOT http. (Optional) Ex. true

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: If sent, the format is JSONP (JSON with Padding) with the callback returned with the JSON response. You can put anything in the callback parameter and whatever you send is returned. (Optional) Ex. magicofmacysapi

get.summary: This service allows you to retrieve global ad medi...
get.description: This service allows you to retrieve global ad media, that is Ad's that are not for a specific Product Category ID.  You must know what the Media Pool Name of the Ad is to retrieve the Ad using this call. Please click here for the static documentation.

parameters.name: accept
parameters.description: Output format as JSON or XML (Required) Ex. JSON

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: API Version (New customers should use v3)(Required) Ex. v3

parameters.name: poolName
parameters.description: Media Pool Name. Specify one or more pool names separated by comma Ex. GLOBALFOOTER,ABOVE_NAV_POOL.(Required) Ex. GLOBALFOOTER

parameters.name: secure
parameters.description: By default this is set to false. If set to true links in response will be https NOT http (Optional) Ex. true

parameters.name: callback
parameters.description: If sent, the format is JSONP (JSON with Padding) with the callback returned with the JSON response. You can put anything in the callback parameter and whatever you send is returned.(Optional) Ex. magicofmacysapi
